doc.course_introduction: An introduction to the statistics behind the most popular genomic data science projects. This is the sixth course in the Genomic Big Data Science Specialization from Johns Hopkins University.
doc.course_sub_chapter: [['Welcome to Statistics for Genomic Data Science', 'What is Statistics?', 'Finding Statistics You Can Trust (4:44)', 'Getting Help (3:44)', 'What is Data? doc.reviews: ['I did my best to work through module 1, but encountered one problem after another with installing the various required R packages, due to version issues. From the absence of recent discussion posts it seems that this is not really a current, viable course. From what I have seen of the course, I get the impression that even if package installation went smoothly, the course is more about R than statistics or genomics - which is not what I joined for.', 'Very good course and useful understanding statistical aspects of data.', '\n\nExcellent, but I would be grateful if you could translate all your courses of absolute quality into Spanish. ', 'really a good course for people who want to learn use R to dispose genomic data', 'The professor is really enthusiasm, so I was really impreesed by him. And his teaching is brief, and I can learn key points through the lectures. Great course!', 'Excellent course! Thank you!', 'Really great and in-depth class! thank you', 'talk fast and informative! I enjoyed it a lot.', 'La semana 3 puede hacerse dura, pero el curso es muy completo y recomendable.', None, 'very helpful class. instructor very organized.', 'I have really enjoyed the course and I have learnt different concepts relevant for my current study. ', 'Great place to start learning genomics in R', 'I think this is one of the best courses in this specialization. I found it the most helpful in building together what should be learned in genomic data science. I wish 1) this course was earlier in the specialization, 2) there was additional building from this course to build together the workflow from beginning to end, and 3) reduction or removal of some of the other courses (or other courses taught together with this one).', "It is really great that told me lots of basic statistical information that I didn't know. ", 'Thanks!', 'sometimes termininology was used interchangeably, which can be confusing for a beginner but overall a good introduction to statistcs for genomic data analysis', 'good', 'good', 'Overall, a very good course. Not without its flaws (inconsistent video audio levels), but I have walked away knowing far more about Genomic Data Science than I expected to.', 'Enjoyed it. One of better courses I have taken in Coursera. A good introduction to using statistics in Bioconductor with genomics data. ', 'Nice course. Ready to apply data.', 'good for learning', 'This is totally not for beginners..', 'In the course, easy concepts are well explained, but the more complex topics are very tricky to understand. However, I appreciated the enthusiasm of the teacher a lot']
doc.reviewers: ['By Ian P', 'By Tushar K', 'By Gregorio A A P', 'By 李仕廷', 'By Zhen M', 'By Apostolos Z', 'By Roman S', 'By Alex Z', 'By Juan J S G', 'By Maximo R', 'By Chunyu Z', 'By Luz Y M R', 'By Hamzeh M T', 'By ELISA W', 'By Chuan J', 'By YuanL', 'By Nitin S', 'By Dr. P R I', 'By NAMRATA P', 'By Ryan A H', 'By Saaket V ', 'By Michael R D', 'By Ariful l', 'By Hemanoel P A', 'By Stefanie M']
